posts.raw_content:
Kayfabe.  It's all show. 

Trump's political genius is that he understands show business. True, low-brow show business.  Soap operas.  Trashy reality TV. Professional wrestling.  Garbage social media.  He knows how to get attention. He brought that to politics and he dominated.

Nothing gets eyeballs like fighting and drama.  And not just fighting between the good guy and the bad guy - it's the infighting, the heel turning, the betrayal - that shit is irresistible. As human beings, we cannot NOT watch that. It is impossible to ignore. 

As soon as Trump flipped on the Epstein files months ago, I told my wife something was up.  It was too abrupt, too dramatic, too salacious.  He clearly wants people talking about the files.  It was obvious. 

There have been many things that trump has wanted to avoid and minimize.  HE DOES NOT GO ON TRUTH AND MAKE MULTIPLE POSTS PER DAY ON THOSE SUBJECTS. When he gets asked a question that he doesn't want to talk about, he will AGREE with the interviewer.  "Absolutely, we'll look into that, and we will release it when we can" he'll say.  Then we never hear about it ever again. 

But this - this was cultivated drama. This was a show. I've never seen anything like it. And still the media BARELY covered it.  I've never seen the media try to avoid covering something so bad in my life.  And then on the eve of the vote, he called MGT a traitor.  

Shocking. Reprehensible. And genius. 

Congress had no choice.  427-1.  100-0.  

Maybe I'm wrong, maybe this is the end of Trump. But I wouldn't bet on it.

Edit: why didn't Trump release it himself? 

This to me is pretty silly.  For the same reason the victims aren't naming anyone.  Lawfare.  

The people who are about to go down are the most powerful people in the entire world.  How do you think it would have turned out if Trump unilaterally released this political nuclear bomb?  Impeachment at the very least. Injuctions everywhere.  Would have taken years upon years. 

No, it's better if someone else does it.  Better yet, 532 other people.
posts.author: UndercoverCentipede2
posts.title: My thoughts as a careful student of Donald Trump
posts.content:
Kayfabe. It's all show.

Trump's political genius is that he understands show business. True, low-brow show business. Soap operas. Trashy reality TV. Professional wrestling. Garbage social media. He knows how to get attention. He brought that to politics and he dominated.

Nothing gets eyeballs like fighting and drama. And not just fighting between the good guy and the bad guy - it's the infighting, the heel turning, the betrayal - that shit is irresistible. As human beings, we cannot NOT watch that. It is impossible to ignore.

As soon as Trump flipped on the Epstein files months ago, I told my wife something was up. It was too abrupt, too dramatic, too salacious. He clearly wants people talking about the files. It was obvious.

There have been many things that trump has wanted to avoid and minimize. HE DOES NOT GO ON TRUTH AND MAKE MULTIPLE POSTS PER DAY ON THOSE SUBJECTS. When he gets asked a question that he doesn't want to talk about, he will AGREE with the interviewer. "Absolutely, we'll look into that, and we will release it when we can" he'll say. Then we never hear about it ever again.

But this - this was cultivated drama. This was a show. I've never seen anything like it. And still the media BARELY covered it. I've never seen the media try to avoid covering something so bad in my life. And then on the eve of the vote, he called MGT a traitor.

Shocking. Reprehensible. And genius.

Congress had no choice. 427-1. 100-0.

Maybe I'm wrong, maybe this is the end of Trump. But I wouldn't bet on it.

Edit: why didn't Trump release it himself?

This to me is pretty silly. For the same reason the victims aren't naming anyone. Lawfare.

The people who are about to go down are the most powerful people in the entire world. How do you think it would have turned out if Trump unilaterally released this political nuclear bomb? Impeachment at the very least. Injuctions everywhere. Would have taken years upon years.

No, it's better if someone else does it. Better yet, 532 other people.
